  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tuberlin.pserver.math.matrix.AbstractMatrix

extends java.lang.Object
implements Matrix

      • applyOnElements

        public Matrix applyOnElements(Matrix B,
                              java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator f,
                              Matrix C)
        Description copied from interface: ApplyOnDoubleElements
        Called on A. Computes C = f(A, B) element-wise.
        Note: A and B are wlog. of shape n x m and o x p respectively. It has to hold that n <= o and m <= p. Also the shape of A an C have to be the same.
        Specified by:
        applyOnElements in interface ApplyOnDoubleElements<Matrix>
        Parameters:
        B - containing the elements that are used as second arguments in f
        f - Binary higher order function f: x, y -> z
        C - to store the result in
        Returns:
        A after computing C = f(A, B) element-wise.

      • addVectorToRows

        public Matrix addVectorToRows(Matrix v,
                              Matrix B)
        Description copied from interface: Matrix
        Called on Matrix A. Computes b = a + v for each row-vector a and b in A and B respectively. Note: It has to hold that A.cols() == v.length(). Also, A and B have to be of the same shape.
        Specified by:
        addVectorToRows in interface Matrix
        Parameters:
        v - Vector to add on each row-vector in A
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing b = a + v for each row-vector a and b in A and B respectively.

                              Matrix B)
        Description copied from interface: Matrix
        Called on Matrix A. Computes b = a + v for each column-vector a and b in A and B respectively. Note: It has to hold that A.rows() == v.length(). Also, A and B have to be of the same shape.
        Specified by:
        addVectorToCols in interface Matrix
        Parameters:
        v - Vector to add on each col-vector in A
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
